error.title: Final is not chunked
error.rfc: If any transfer coding other than chunked is applied to a request payload body, the sender MUST apply chunked as the final transfer coding to ensure that the message is properly framed.

error.title: contains chunked more than once
error.rfc: A sender MUST NOT apply chunked more than once to a message body (i.e., chunking an already chunked message is not allowed).

internal.title: Not decoding :
internal.explain: HTTPolice does not know how to decode the transfer coding. (This doesn’t mean that it’s wrong.)

error.title: Incomplete message according to
error.explain: This message’s header indicates that the body is bytes long, but there are fewer bytes remaining on the stream.

internal.title: Stop parsing request stream due to errors
internal.explain: Due to previous errors, the request stream is in an undefined state at this point, and HTTPolice will not try to parse the remaining bytes.

error.title: Not enough requests for this response
error.explain: If HTTPolice is parsing things correctly, it seems that there is no request corresponding to this response. HTTPolice will check this response in isolation.

internal.title: Stop parsing response stream due to errors
internal.explain: Due to previous errors, the response stream is in an undefined state at this point, and HTTPolice will not try to parse the remaining bytes.

internal.title: Stop parsing response stream after switching protocols
internal.explain: The response status code indicates that the connection has switched to a different protocol. HTTPolice will not parse the remainder of the response stream.

internal.title: Stop parsing response stream after switching to a tunnel
internal.explain: A successful () response to a request indicates that the connection has switched to being a tunnel. HTTPolice will not parse the remainder of the response stream.

error.title: Multiple headers
error.rfc: A sender MUST NOT generate multiple header fields with the same field name in a message unless either the entire field value for that header field is defined as a comma-separated list [i.e., #(values)] or the header field is a well-known exception (as noted below).

comment.title: RWS is not a single space in
comment.explain: The specification for includes the rule named RWS. It should be generated by senders as just a single space, but here it was characters. See .
